Package core

Interface HlaPhysicalEntityValueListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HlaPhysicalEntityValueListener.Adapter
    public interface HlaPhysicalEntityValueListener
    Listener for updates of attributes, with the new updated values.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  HlaPhysicalEntityValueListener.Adapter
      An abstract adapter class that implements the HlaPhysicalEntityValueListener interface with empty methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      This method is called when the attribute centerOfMass is updated.

      This method is called when the attribute parentReferenceFrame is updated.

      This method is called when the producing federate of an attribute is changed.

    • Method Detail

      • nameUpdated

        void nameUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 boolean validOldName,
                 java.lang.String oldName,
                 HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                 HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute name is updated.
        Description from the FOM: A non-empty string that identifies the entity. Each entity instance in the federation must have a unique name.
        Description of the data type from the FOM:
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        name - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldName - True if oldName contains a valid value
        oldName - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • typeUpdated

        void typeUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                 java.lang.String type,
                 boolean validOldType,
                 java.lang.String oldType,
                 HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                 HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute type is updated.
        Description from the FOM: A non-empty string that identifies the entity type. It is not a mandatory field but it can be used to differentiate from a fuel tank and a space vehicle for example.
        Description of the data type from the FOM:
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        type - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldType - True if oldType contains a valid value
        oldType - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • statusUpdated

        void statusUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                   java.lang.String status,
                   boolean validOldStatus,
                   java.lang.String oldStatus,
                   HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                   HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute status is updated.
        Description from the FOM: An informative string that documents the current status of the entity (whatever that might be).
        Description of the data type from the FOM:
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        status - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldStatus - True if oldStatus contains a valid value
        oldStatus - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • parentReferenceFrameUpdated

        void parentReferenceFrameUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                                 java.lang.String parentReferenceFrame,
                                 boolean validOldParentReferenceFrame,
                                 java.lang.String oldParentReferenceFrame,
                                 HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                                 HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute parentReferenceFrame is updated.
        Description from the FOM: The non-empty string that identifies the reference frame with respect to which the kinematic state attributes of this entity are calculated. This string must exactly match the name of some ReferenceFrame instance in the federation.
        Description of the data type from the FOM:
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        parentReferenceFrame - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldParentReferenceFrame - True if oldParentReferenceFrame contains a valid value
        oldParentReferenceFrame - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • stateUpdated

        void stateUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                  SpaceTimeCoordinateState state,
                  boolean validOldState,
                  SpaceTimeCoordinateState oldState,
                  HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                  HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute state is updated.
        Description from the FOM: A four dimensional representation of the entity's translational and rotational state with respect to its parent reference frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A multi-dimensional representation of an observational coordinate frame and associated state. There are three spatial dimensions, three attitude dimensions and one time dimension. The spatial and attitude components define a right-handed orthogonal set of coordinate axes that constitute a reference frame. The time dimension specifies the 'position' of the coordinate with respect to the physical time scale (TT).
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        state - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldState - True if oldState contains a valid value
        oldState - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • accelerationUpdated

        void accelerationUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                         double[] acceleration,
                         boolean validOldAcceleration,
                         double[] oldAcceleration,
                         HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                         HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute acceleration is updated.
        Description from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the acceleration of the entity body frame origin (i.e., the entity's center of mass) with respect to the parent reference frame. This is the time derivative of the velocity vector as seen by an observer fixed in the parent frame. The components of this vector are resolved onto the coordinate axes of the parent frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of a vector velocity of some point with respect to another as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        acceleration - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldAcceleration - True if oldAcceleration contains a valid value
        oldAcceleration - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • rotationalAccelerationUpdated

        void rotationalAccelerationUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                                   double[] rotationalAcceleration,
                                   boolean validOldRotationalAcceleration,
                                   double[] oldRotationalAcceleration,
                                   HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                                   HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute rotationalAcceleration is updated.
        Description from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the angular acceleration of the entity body frame with respect to the parent reference frame. This is the time derivative of the angular velocity vector as seen by an observer fixed in the parent frame. The components of this vector are resolved onto the coordinate axes of the entity body frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of an angular velocity vector as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which angular velocity, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        rotationalAcceleration - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldRotationalAcceleration - True if oldRotationalAcceleration contains a valid value
        oldRotationalAcceleration - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • centerOfMassUpdated

        void centerOfMassUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                         double[] centerOfMass,
                         boolean validOldCenterOfMass,
                         double[] oldCenterOfMass,
                         HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                         HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute centerOfMass is updated.
        Description from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the position of the entity center of mass (the body frame origin) with respect to the origin of the entity's structural frame. The components of this vector are resolved onto the coordinate axes of the structural frame.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: A 3-vector that specifies the translational position of one point with respect to another. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        centerOfMass - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldCenterOfMass - True if oldCenterOfMass contains a valid value
        oldCenterOfMass - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • bodyWrtStructuralUpdated

        void bodyWrtStructuralUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                              AttitudeQuaternion bodyWrtStructural,
                              boolean validOldBodyWrtStructural,
                              AttitudeQuaternion oldBodyWrtStructural,
                              HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                              HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the attribute bodyWrtStructural is updated.
        Description from the FOM: An attitude quaternion that specifies the orientation of an entity's body frame with respect to the entity's structural frame. This attitude quaternion should never change. If not specified, an identity quaternion is assumed.
        Description of the data type from the FOM: This is a quaternion quantifying the orientation of a 'subject' reference frame with respect to some other 'referent' frame. Quaternions consist of one scalar component and a 3-element vector component and can be denoted Q = (s, V), where s is a scalar and V is a vector (x, y, z). Confusion often arises regarding the meaning of the quaternion. (There are several similar but incompatible conventions.) This data type defines a so-called 'left unit transformation quaternion'. It may be used to transform the elements of a vector V_R = (xR, yR, zR) resolved in the referent frame's coordinate axes into the corresponding elements of a vector V_S = (xS, yS, zS) resolved in the subject frame's coordinate axes (i.e. determine the components of the same vector in another coordinate system). The quaternion transformation formula is (0, V_A) = Q . (0, V_B) . Q*, where '.' denotes quaternion multiplication and * denotes quaternion conjugation. The formula for multiplication of the quaternion Q1 = (s1, V1) where V1 is the vector (x1, y1, z1) by the quaternion Q2 = (s2, V2) where V2 is the vector (x2, y2, z2) is Q3 = Q1 . Q2 = (s3, V3) where s3 = s1 s2 - (x1 x2 + y1 y2 + z1 z2) and V3 = (x3, y3, z3) with x3 = s1 x2 + s2 x1 + (y1 z2 - z1 y2), y3 = s1 y2 + s2 y1 + (z1 x2 - x1 z2) and z3 = s1 z2 + s2 z1 + (x1 y2 - y1 x2). The formula for conjugation of the quaternion Q = (s, V), where V is the vector (x, y, z) is Q* = (s, -V) = (s, (-x, -y, -z)).
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        bodyWrtStructural - The new value of the attribute in this update
        validOldBodyWrtStructural - True if oldBodyWrtStructural contains a valid value
        oldBodyWrtStructural - The old value of the attribute
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.

      • producingFederateUpdated

        void producingFederateUpdated​(HlaPhysicalEntity physicalEntity,
                              HlaPhysicalEntityAttributes.Attribute attribute,
                              HlaFederateId oldProducingFederate,
                              HlaFederateId newProducingFederate,
                              HlaTimeStamp timeStamp,
                              HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
        This method is called when the producing federate of an attribute is changed. Only available when using HLA Evolved.
        Parameters:
        physicalEntity - The object which is updated.
        attribute - The attribute that now has a new producing federate
        oldProducingFederate - The federate handle of the old producing federate
        newProducingFederate - The federate handle of the new producing federate
        timeStamp - The time when the update was initiated.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the update was initiated.
